Key Match Events: Deniz Undav scored twice in the first half to give Germany a 2-0 lead.
Edin Dzeko scored in the 70th minute to reduce the deficit for Bosnia-Herzegovina.
A member of the Bosnia-Herzegovina coaching team was sent off as tempers rose.
Germany's Deniz Undav had a hat-trick goal disallowed in the second half.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany lamented the absences of Jamal Musiala and Kai Havertz before the match.
Post-Match Reflections: Germany moved onto seven points from three games in League A Group 3.
Bosnia-Herzegovina dropped to fourth place after equalling their longest-ever winless run of nine straight matches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany had 73% possession compared to Bosnia-Herzegovina's 27%.
Germany had 12 shots with 4 on target, while Bosnia-Herzegovina had 8 shots with 1 on target.
Germany will host the Netherlands at the Allianz Arena on October 14.
Bosnia-Herzegovina will play against Hungary in Zenica on October 14.
